message: the topics should have unread counts as well
and direct link to app store: http://itunes.apple.com/app/vorepad/id432161192?mt=8
Hi all, I just released VorePad today. It's a great iPad client for Convore. HN Link: http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=2474743
that looks like an awesome app great job
/play greatjob

Don't get me wrong I feel like a dick saying that. I love the app and it's worth the $4. Question though, the groups themselves say [6] or [number] when there are messages but the individual topics don't have that? #updatenumberoneplease
ah yes, it syncs instantly :)
I'm glad I don't have an iPad anymore. It's because of the iPad platform itself and not the individual app makers IMO that people wind up spending $30/mo on apps.
$4 seemed a bit much, but at the same time Convore isn't something used by millions and millions of people so you have a limited target audience and bla bla who cares. Bought it and it's awesome.
thanks!
have you thought about making a lite version with ads, to bring the cost down or make it completely free? i wouldn't mind some ads interjected into the app
maybe, but really... it's only $4
I think it might be because I'm also browsing on the PC. Derp.
@Lloyd btw, thanks! glad you like it :)
Hmm. /reboots
That would be why :) Sorry.
perhaps they are from older topics?

it's really sad when things that are < $5 are labelled "really expensive" (i'm even guilty of it myself when browsing apps), but if you are a heavy convore user, then really $4 should be totally worth it. it's not some trivial fart app, so i feel the price is justified
...but it looks like a nice recreation of the website experience on a laptop :)
...right down to the mention notices
yes, i tried to recreate the experience as closely as possible so users would feel very comfortable with it

I agree on the cost part: $4 isn't much.  Of course, the problem is that I'd like to try out far too many apps, so the cost becomes $4 x (large number)... I did decide to skip the latte today and try VorePad instead.
well thank you :) i owe you a latte!
yeah, there are a few goofy things w/ portrait mode... landscape should be really solid tho

Pretty neat. This'll probably get me using Convore more. The 'default' screen is a little confusing, since it looks like you can add a message even though you're not in a topic. Also the group menu doesn't show up consistently in portrait orientation. Good first pass though. I look forward to the updates :)
Dunno about others, but I mark-as-read much more often than I leave a group. Maybe that'd be a better action for the swipe?
Ok
One thing I would suggest is to ramp up the UI. One of the things I like the most about Convore is the simple and beautiful interface... The logo for VorePad looks like it was done in paint?
just bought vorepad but it does not work: no login screen, no preferences, just an empty set of lines.
solved. bug report: the login screen never appears if your screen is locked in portrait mode:-)
@dustinchilson I noticed that too, fun little easter egg :)
I like it. The sun guy peeking out of the top when you pull the pane all the way down is a nice touch.
i do both the ios and android dev for notifo
yes you can... in the "+" menu in the Topic or Groups lists
@rigoneri I love the logo! Makes me smile :)
The portrait lock bug will be fixed in update. Definite oversight on my part
i like both about equally; they both have their pros and cons though

ah, cool. I like your reply to Sahil...if you actually went into argument mode the best thing would probably be it's practice, bootstrapping, and that working on multiple things helps with motivation. :)
Sure
Reading this topic itonically
There are a couple other easter eggs too :)
Ok that could be more obvious :)
@imajes yes, moved that option in the update
I was reminded by @slavingia's comment: http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=2475253
Just loaded the topic
Yes the logo is meant to be playful. I can't do graphics so I went for deliberately cartoonish
@bat there are multiple reasons i worked on the vorepad app even tho we are running notifo, but there is actually some truth in my lack of sleep :)
how do you like iOS development, and how does it compare to Android development?
Are you and @stammy both writing code for Notifo for Android?
Just Managed to make vorepad crash
hah nice... by doing anything in particular?
Can I do mark all as read from the app?
you can mark topics/groups as favorite and a growl msg will show if a new msg comes into those (if you are not currently viewing that topic)
but i'll think of some way to do a visual flash for current topic
Another crash :(
yeah, known bug on some message deletes :(
O something like that
Don't want to be distracted by audio but quick visual is ok
saw this: https://convore.com/vorepad
Want to have the iPad open for periods while I am working
Seems like work :/
so some sort of visual indication that a new msg came into open topic?
possibly.. what about sound (like the convore site ding?)
Chad, can you make it do pulses/yellow flashes on new content?
or rather be visual?
Sound is off.
Harder to tab to the iPad :)
damn, $4
i dont have an ipad :(
Test
Good stuff. I'm on it right now.
Hi
Sweet!
Using it now!
@jazzychad Got it...good job...thanks.
About price, I use the FREE iPhone client and I have not ever visited the site.
Intrigued to know the sales metrics, if you're willing to share? :)
